alert.note: Alert for Platte (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued October 11 at 1:53PM MDT until October 11 at 2:45PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Platte County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 245 PM MDT. * At 153 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles south of Sibley Peak, or 18 miles north of Wheatland, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Guernsey, Guernsey Campground, Sibley Peak, Glendo Reservoir, Two Moon Campground and Hartville. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 92 and 109. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne.
